required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Low Creatinine Level and Respiratory Failure
clinical_study.official_title: A Correlation of Low Serum Creatinine Levels and Respiratory Function in the Mechanically Ventilated Patients in the Intensive Care Unit

collaborator.agency: Josip Juraj Strossmayer University of Osijek

brief_summary.textblock: Low creatinine levels may be a sign of muscle atrophy or weakness, and therefore predictive for respiratory insufficiency in the Intensive care unit (ICU) patients. The investigators compared the outcomes of participants with low creatinine levels with subsequent ICU participants admitted into ICU in the tertiary hospital.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators have found a total of 46 participants with low creatinine levels and compared their outcome data with a group of participants with normal or high creatinine levels (control group, N=61). Low creatinine was defined as values of ≤40 μmol/L. Demographic data, type of admission (medical vs. surgical), hemoglobin values, CRP, and ventilator days were compared. A statistical analysis was performed using chi square and T-test.

primary_outcome.measure: Length of mechanical ventilation treatment in group with low serume creatinine level
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The investigators compared length of mechanical ventilation treatment between group with low serume creatinine level and control group

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of stay in ICU in group with low serume creatinine level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators compared length of stay in ICU between group with low serume creatinine level and control group

secondary_outcome.measure: White blood cell values in group with low creatinine level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators compared white blood cell values between group with low creatinine level and control group

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobine values in group with low creatinine level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators compared hemoglobine values between group with low creatinine level and control group

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who started nutrition in ICU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators compared number of patients between group with low creatinine level and control group who started nutrition in ICU

secondary_outcome.measure: Platelets values in group with low creatinine level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators compared platelet values between group with low creatinine level and control group

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who receive blood products transfusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators compared number of patients who received blood products between group with low creatinine level and control group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators compared number of patients who were discharged from intensive care unit to the ward between group with low creatinine level and control group

arm_group.description: Total of 46 patients with low serum creatinine levels whose values were obtained from the central laboratory with inclusion criteria (< 40mmol/L)
A total of 61 consecutive patients were obtained who were treated in ICU CHC Osijek, according to the date of admission.

intervention.description: Comparison of treatment length using mechanical ventilaton, length of stay in ICU, survival between two groups

study_pop.textblock: Study group was selected by measuring low serume creatinine levels (≤40 µmol/L) during the treatment in ICU. Control group was obtained by consecutive selection of patients according to the date of admission to the ICU.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Inclusion criteria for study group was value of ≤40 µmol/L serume creatinine level during hospitalization in ICU from July 2015 to November 2016.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who were younger than 18 years
